Class SmartDeviceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • SmartDeviceController

  • public class SmartDeviceController
extends java.lang.Object
    The SmartDeviceController class is contains all methods for control all SmartDevices
    See Also:
    SmartDevice

      • workloads

        public static java.util.Dictionary<java.util.Date,java.util.ArrayList<Workload>> workloads
        Contains workloads that will execute according to their executing times.
        Key - An Date that represents executing time.
        Value - A ArrayList<Workload> that represents workloads.
        See Also:
        Workload

        Mapping dictionary for converting user Action names to method names.

      • actionHandler

        public static java.lang.Object actionHandler(Action action)
                                      throws DeviceExceptions
        Converts the Action to MethodClass and invokes the method.
        Parameters:
        action - An Action that provides from user.
        Returns:
        An Object that contains response of the invoked method.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is an illegal Action, it throws an DeviceException.
        See Also:
        Action, MethodClass

      • zReport

        public static java.lang.String zReport(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                                throws DeviceExceptions
        Creates the report of all devices and returns it.
        Parameters:
        values - An ArrayList<String> that contains nothing for executing.
        Returns:
        A String that is the report of devices.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is an invalid command.
        See Also:
        Utilities

      • nop

        public static void nop(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                throws DeviceExceptions

        Skips forwards the time to the next workload time and runs all workloads that has this executing time if there is.

        Parameters:
        values - An ArrayList<String> that contains nothing for executing.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - It throws exception if there is no workload.
        See Also:
        Workload, Validations

        public static java.lang.String setInitialTime(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                                       throws DeviceExceptions
        Sets the time for once.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Time value as String.

        Returns:
        A String that is a success message if success. Otherwise, it returns null.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is illegal argument or time is setted before, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        Validations, Utilities

                               throws DeviceExceptions
        Removes a SmartDevice with using device name.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        Name of the device as String.

        Returns:
        A String that is a success message if success.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        Validations

      • switchStatus

        public static void switchStatus(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                         throws DeviceExceptions
        Switches the SmartDevice.status of the SmartDevice with using device name.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Name of the device as String.
        -New status of the device as String (On/Off)

        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name or new status is old status of device, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        Validations, Utilities

        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Name of the device as String.
        -Switch time of the device as String.

        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name or switch time is not valid, it gives an error.

        Validations, Utilities

      • changeName

        public static void changeName(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                       throws DeviceExceptions
        Changes the device name to new name that given.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Name of the device as String.
        -New name of the device as String.

        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name or there is a device that name is new name or old name and new name are the same, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        Validations

      • plugIn

        public static void plugIn(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                   throws DeviceExceptions
        Plugs in a device to the SmartPlug.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Name of the device as String.
        -Ampere value of the device that plugged in as String.

        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name or new ampere value is not positive or there is a device that already plugged in to this {code SmartPlug}, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        SmartPlug

      • plugOut

        public static void plugOut(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
                    throws DeviceExceptions
        Plugs out the device that is already plugged in to the SmartPlug.
        Parameters:
        values -

        An ArrayList<String> that contains:
        -Name of the device as String.

        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions - If there is no device that name is given name or there is not a device that already plugged in to this {code SmartPlug}, it gives an error.
        See Also:
        SmartPlug
